text: @ScrambledAdams The captain, who had been standing with her back to the scene of the crime myself.

passages.full_quote: <used>The captain, who had</used> so long been a cause of so much discomfort, was gone where the wicked cease from troubling
21 The Attack AS soon as Silver disappeared, the <used>captain, who had been</used> closely watching him, turned towards the interior of the house and found not a man of us at his post but Gray

Harriet<used>, who had been standing</used> in no unhappy reverie, was yet very glad to be called from it, by the now encouraging manner of such a judge, and such a friend as Miss Woodhouse, and only wanted invitation, to give the history of her hopes with great, though trembling

passages.fragment: who had been standing with her back to the
passages.full_quote: When I emerged at last on the course, it was quite unexpectedly and with such vigour that I cannoned heavily into a young lady <used>who had been standing with her back to the</used> plantation

passages.fragment: her back to the scene of the
passages.full_quote: What had brought <used>her back to the scene of the</used> murder

passages.fragment: the scene of the crime myself
passages.full_quote: I had a mind to study <used>the scene of the crime myself</used>
